Job Title: Child and Family Play Therapist - Independent Contractor
Job Description:
Creative Family Counseling, an outpatient private practice that serves children, adolescents, and adults in individual, couples, & family therapy, seeks an independent contractor therapist to work with children, teens, and families. We are seeking those with experience and/or specialized training in treating issues commonly seen in children such as outbursts/tantrums, behavior issues, stress/anxiety, trauma, self-esteem, depressed mood, ADHD, etc. It is important for us to find someone who is passionate in helping children and their parents within a systemic framework and who is a self-motivated person. The ideal candidate would have a foundation and experience in utilizing expressive and play therapies and be open to becoming Certified in the Positive Discipline parenting curriculum.
Candidate must be passionate about working with children between ages 3 and 18. The primary caseload for this Therapist's position will be for clients ages 3-13.
The hours are flexible. You set your own appointments in collaboration with other therapists who use the fully furnished play therapy offices.

About us
Autism F.I.R.S.T. Our mission is to deliver on our belief in Relational Autism Care, a simple and profound belief that as autism so greatly impacts the family dynamic that the treatment care must support and be available for all members of the family that are touched and impacted by autism – the patient, the family and all caregivers.
Autism F.I.R.S.T. is Northern Virginia’s only autism therapy practice to provide the ultimate collaborative treatment, advocacy, support, and care for the autistic child, family, and caregivers. We are seeking a Licensed Family Counselor (LPC; LCSW; LMFT) to contract with our team. Recognizing the profound impact autism has on the family and support system, we seek to provide broad collaborative care. The counselor will focus on providing family counseling services and support to the families and caregivers of autistic children following our relational autism care model.

The Behavioral Health Center for Counseling & Learning, LLC is a thriving private practice that is a leader in providing exceptional services in Connecticut since 2006. The Center provides comprehensive services (individual, couples, families, and group therapy) throughout the entire developmental lifespan, from toddler to adolescent, and adult through geriatric. Our diverse clinical team has expertise in helping our clients address all of the issues that act as barriers to positive development and the achievement of success.
Our integrative approaches to wellness are unparalleled.
We are offering an exciting opportunity to practice as an independent contractor, while having the benefit of working with a skilled team of licensed and experienced professionals, some of whom have been practicing for decades.
Successful candidates must be licensed in CT.
Company Name: The Behavioral Health Center for Counseling & Learning, LLC

ABOUT US
At Vida, we empower individuals to overcome chronic mental and physical health conditions, once and for all. The impact of chronic conditions on healthcare is immense: in the US alone, chronic diseases like diabetes and heart disease drive 80% of the $3 trillion healthcare spending, which is at 18% of GDP. One in 3 individuals has a chronic health condition, and 1 in 4 struggles with mental health.
Vida provides expert, personalized, on-demand health coaching and programs from a network of experienced health care providers and leading medical institutions. Vida is a next generation continuous care platform for both consumers and businesses, combining a consumer mobile app, an enterprise care platform offering on demand 24/7 solutions for chronic conditions. Vida platform runs in the cloud, captures real-time data from 100+ devices and apps, and integrates back to the employer, payer, and provider. We are trusted by Fortune 1000 companies, major national payers and large providers to enable their employees live their healthiest lives.

We are one hour from Philadelphia, 2 hours from New York City, and 3 hours from Washington D.C. As a group, we are committed to working at the highest level of professional excellence, with a passionate pursuit of integration of faith in all that we do. Blair Counseling and Mediation is a group practice that enjoys stable professional relationships as colleagues and are looking to expand our ability to support families. This role may be part-time or full-time.
Blair Counseling and Mediation works to provide tools to all ages that can be used to save marriages, relationships, manage depression or anxiety, and help children with behavioral concerns. We are certified to complete anger evaluations and anger management sessions for court. We provide a respectful and understanding approach to addiction. Our expert mediators aim to bring peace to marriages, families, divorces, and any other dispute. In addition to marriage and family mediation, we can provide divorce mediation, co-parenting counseling, reunification therapy and supervised visitations.
Christian, Spanish, American Sign Language and premarital services are also available. We also offer clinical supervision and underscore the importance of maintaining professional boundaries. Blair Counseling uses evidence-based practices like solution-focused, cognitive-behavioral, Gottman Couples Therapy, and Internal Family Systems Therapy to meet treatment goals.

Job Title: Mental Health Therapist - Oak Brook/Naperville Part Time
Job Description:
Wonder is seeking a mental health therapist in the Naperville/Oak Brook area to provide home and community-based treatment centered on a holistic and integrative family systems approach. This is a part time contract role with the potential to build to full time employment.
Who we are:
Wonder was created with the intent to provide therapeutic support services for pre-teens, adolescents, young adults and their families by combining individual and parent coaching with family therapy. Research shows that engaging teens and young adults in their own environment allows for faster, more authentic and longer therapeutic connection. Therefore, our mental health therapists meet clients in the community rather than in an office. Our aspiration is to ensure sustainable change for a lifetime.
What we offer:

Work from Home!!
NAMHS is looking for Licensed Marriage and Family Therapists and Licensed Clinical Social Workers to join our team. This is a work-from-home position that allows for flexible scheduling. Eliminate the daily commute, reduce exposure to illnesses, and gain the flexibility you need and deserve. This can be done remotely from anywhere in the US. We only require you to have a valid in California License. NAMHS is looking for patient focused employees for a variety of patients. If you have the necessary skills and experience to succeed in this role, we want to hear from you.
What we offer:
We offer an unmatched extensive training program for our providers to be successful. We offer a full benefits package including paid vacation, sick time, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and 401K.

Provide individual, group, family and marriage/couples counseling sessions as documented in individuals’ person-centered-plans

Maintaining clinically appropriate documentation on all services provided in a timely manner

Coordinate care with the quality assurance and quality improvement functions of the agency

Job Title: NY State licensed LCSW, LMHC, LMFT, Psychologist or Psychiatric NP
Job Description:
NY State licensed Psychotherapist or Psychologist
We are a private practice that has been in Kingston for more than 30 years. We are seeking NY State licensed psychotherapists - social workers (LCSW- best with R), Marriage and Family therapist, or psychologists - on a fee-for-service (hourly employment) basis. Looking for someone who has experience working with children, adolescents and adults.
I am a licensed psychologist, certified playtherapist-supervisor, certified group therapist, energy psychologist, sandtray therapist and modern psychoanalyst. I have been in practice in Kingston for more than 30 years. Presently, there are three psychologists, six clinical social workers, six licensed mental health counselors, one marriage and family therapist, one music therapist working several limited permit holders with me on a fee-for-service basis.
The office provides clients, office staff, office space, an electronic health record program, credentialing, and billing. At the moment all services are conducted via telehealth. We offer health insurance, vision and dental insurance, a retirement plan, and a match to the retirement plan, paid vacation and a bonus for extended hours worked on a quarterly basis. We are a very colleague-based team, and try to help each other out as much as possible. We usually have one social get together during the summer and one during the winter. We provide two weekly group consultations and individual consultation on an as needed basis. The practice is mainly managed care based, thus it would be very helpful if you were eligible or already on the managed care panels.
Company Name: Grunblatt Psychology and Counseling Offices, PC

Job Title: Mental Health Therapist - Part Time NJ
Job Description:
Wonder is seeking a mental health therapist to provide home and community-based treatment centered on a holistic and integrative family systems approach. This is a part time contract role with the potential to build to full time employment.
Who we are:
Wonder was created with the intent to provide therapeutic support services for pre-teens, adolescents, young adults and their families by combining individual and parent coaching with family therapy. Research shows that engaging teens and young adults in their own environment allows for faster, more authentic and longer therapeutic connection. Therefore, our mental health therapists meet clients in the community rather than in an office. Our aspiration is to ensure sustainable change for a lifetime.
What we offer:

Provide individual, group, family and marriage/couples counseling sessions as documented in individuals’ person-centered-plans
Completion of clinically appropriate assessments, person-centered planning, and therapeutic interventions for all individuals served
Completion and maintenance of admission documentation, NCTOPPS, Treatment Authorization Requests (TARS), other relevant documentation for all individuals served and appropriate referral feedback information in a timely manner
Maintaining clinically appropriate documentation on all services provided in a timely manner
Ensure that clinically appropriate services are delivered to eligible recipients within the service definition (right person, right treatment, right intensity, frequency, and duration)
Coordinate care with the quality assurance and quality improvement functions of the agency

About Us:
Newport Healthcare is a nationwide behavioral healthcare organization dedicated to transforming young lives through evidence-based care. To that end, we have assembled the best teen and young adult mental health treatment staff in the country, and we want you to join us. While our experts guide our clients to sustainable healing, our job is to support our valued staff members, and we do that through offering industry-competitive salaries, career growth and skills expansion, student loan repayment and tuition reimbursement, and a company commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, among other advantages. Be part of a team that's dedicated to providing compassionate care based in authentic connection, mutual respect, and unconditional love—and experience the rewards of making a difference in the lives of young people and their families each and every day.
Empowering Lives. Restoring Families.®

Our mission is to thoughtfully guide the whole person on their journey to find clarity and mental wellness by providing exceptional holistic care. We are seeking to add Clinical Therapists (LCSW/LSW, LCPC/LPC, LMFT) to our team of highly skilled clinicians.
Our staff of Psychiatrists, Physician Assistants and Psychotherapists offers the latest medication and therapy treatment as we help guide our clients towards mental wellness and a balanced personal and professional lifestyle. This multi-disciplinary approach allows us to provide holistic care in psychiatry, psychotherapy and much more. Our team offers a broad range of specialties, services, and orientations to support and help all persons regardless of their place in life.
What do we offer to you?
Clarity offers you administrative and marketing support so you can have a consistent client base and concentrate on your greatest priority...helping your clients move forward in life!

Lebanon

Career Description:
Our outpatient mental health therapist work with children and families with a variety of social-emotional concerns, complex life experiences, and mental health diagnosis. Professionally trained and licensed outpatient mental health therapist at Birchlawn Place Counseling Center, INC will partner with children and their families to foster decreased internal conflict, increased insight and resiliency, coping, healthy connections, and emotional wellness within children and families. Specifically providing individual psychotherapy, developing and implementing clinical treatment plans, completing diagnostic assessments, and maintaining their clients' progress notes and mental health records. Outpatient mental health therapist will have the opportunity to provide family psychotherapy, group psychotherapy, and other innovative programming if desired.
Birchlawn Place Counseling Center, INC offers a mental health workplace environment that is safe, non-judgmental, validating, and always striving to provide a felt experience of connection and belonging. Our clinical team flourishes through mutual collaboration and teamwork. Here at Birchlawn Place, we support growth in individual mental health therapist's areas of interests, strengths, and expertise. We welcome innovative ideas for bridging the gap between children and families’ mental health needs and access to holistic and equitable community based mental health services. Our clinical team values the importance of balancing each mental health therapist’s professional life and personal life thus we offer full-time and part-time positions in which mental health therapists can create their own work schedule. Our mental health therapist are independent contractors who enter into a mutually beneficial contract with Birchlawn Place Counseling Center, INC that offers an array of innovative benefits for the independent contractor/mental health therapist that contracts with our group private practice.

Contract Therapist for Private Practice
Job Summary
Therapists are responsible for treatment planning and implementation of evidence based therapeutic interventions. Service locations may include office, online, community (on-site counseling at partnered organizations), in-home services, and school settings. Therapists work collaboratively with clients in treatment planning to achieve personal goals.
Responsibilities and Duties
Establish a non-judgmental therapeutic environment
Treat all clients with unconditional positive regard
Maintain professional standards outlined in the ACA, NASW and/or applicable professional Code of Ethics

Help the most vulnerable.
We Shelter, We Support, We Guide, and We Care for the most vulnerable in our communities.
Some people can’t imagine doing what we do. We can’t imagine not doing it. At Volunteers of America of Florida, we are more than a non-profit organization. Job Title: Mental Health Therapist - Part Time NJ
Job Description:
Wonder is seeking a mental health therapist to provide home and community-based treatment centered on a holistic and integrative family systems approach. This is a part time contract role with the potential to build to full time employment.
Who we are:
Wonder was created with the intent to provide therapeutic support services for pre-teens, adolescents, young adults and their families by combining individual and parent coaching with family therapy. Research shows that engaging teens and young adults in their own environment allows for faster, more authentic and longer therapeutic connection. Therefore, our mental health therapists meet clients in the community rather than in an office. Our aspiration is to ensure sustainable change for a lifetime.
What we offer:

Provide individual, group, family and marriage/couples counseling sessions as documented in individuals’ person-centered-plans
Completion of clinically appropriate assessments, person-centered planning, and therapeutic interventions for all individuals served
Completion and maintenance of admission documentation, NCTOPPS, Treatment Authorization Requests (TARS), other relevant documentation for all individuals served and appropriate referral feedback information in a timely manner
Maintaining clinically appropriate documentation on all services provided in a timely manner
Ensure that clinically appropriate services are delivered to eligible recipients within the service definition (right person, right treatment, right intensity, frequency, and duration)
Coordinate care with the quality assurance and quality improvement functions of the agency

About Us:
Newport Healthcare is a nationwide behavioral healthcare organization dedicated to transforming young lives through evidence-based care. To that end, we have assembled the best teen and young adult mental health treatment staff in the country, and we want you to join us. While our experts guide our clients to sustainable healing, our job is to support our valued staff members, and we do that through offering industry-competitive salaries, career growth and skills expansion, student loan repayment and tuition reimbursement, and a company commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, among other advantages. Be part of a team that's dedicated to providing compassionate care based in authentic connection, mutual respect, and unconditional love—and experience the rewards of making a difference in the lives of young people and their families each and every day.
Empowering Lives. Restoring Families.®

Is This You?

About us
Group Therapy Associates is a private psychotherapy practice that believes in the power of therapy to help every person show up more fully for their lives and their communities. Our work is built on three core principles - stay curious, honor emotions, act with intention. We help people who aren't sure if therapy was designed for them find an approach to mental health care that honors all the facets of who they are and helps them combine knowledge and self awareness into choices that cultivate a more purposeful and fulfilling life.
GTA is a passionate about changing the narrative of mental health through advocacy, creativity, and by actively engaging people who feel left out of the conversation with comes to what truly makes effective mental health care. Therapy should be innovative, evolving, culturally attuned, and highly accessible to all.

Our relational team is committed to a mission of restoring souls to health and peace. Through Agape, enjoy the benefits of collaborating with your colleagues, gaining professional development and building your private practice with team members, who share your core values as a therapist.
We are passionate about helping individuals and families work through struggles with depression, anxiety, addictions, eating disorders, grief, trauma, PTSD, and co-occurring disorders.
For over 19 years, Agape Counseling has earned a stellar reputation, our clinicians are well respected in the community and known for specialized skills offering treatment for children to geriatrics and each life stage in between.

The Behavioral Health Center for Counseling & Learning, LLC is a thriving private practice that is a leader in providing exceptional services in Connecticut since 2006. The Center provides comprehensive services (individual, couples, families, and group therapy) throughout the entire developmental lifespan, from toddler to adolescent, and adult through geriatric. Our diverse clinical team has expertise in helping our clients address all of the issues that act as barriers to positive development and the achievement of success.
Our integrative approaches to wellness are unparalleled.
We are offering an exciting opportunity to practice as an independent contractor, while having the benefit of working with a skilled team of licensed and experienced professionals, some of whom have been practicing for decades.
Successful candidates must be licensed in CT.
Company Name: The Behavioral Health Center for Counseling & Learning, LLC

Job Description:
Helping people while living satisfying, balanced lives. That is the focus for our team at Elevation Individual and Family Therapy. We are a team of licensed therapists that value providing quality, person-centered services in a low-stress environment to aid in a healthy work-life balance. You set your work hours, complete your progress notes and we take care of the rest! Elevation IFT is looking for a passionate, reliable therapist who enjoys being their own boss and working with clients to achieve their treatment goals.
To learn more about us, visit our website at www.elevationtherapy.org

Company Name: Elevation Individual and Family Therapy, LLC

Job Description:
Licensed Therapist in California
Anchor Counseling Group, Inc. (ACG) is a community oriented group practice in Glendale, California. Our goal is to provide mental health services backed by experience, science, and proven treatments. We strive to make a difference in our community by promoting the growth and development of each of our client’s individual needs.
Our focus is also on providing a supportive environment for our clinicians. Our staff is always there to support the needs of the team and foster a culture of professionalism, collaboration and encouragement.
We are looking for a community minded, compassionate, and clinically skilled Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), and Clinical Psychologist. We have openings for full-time and part-time positions.

Genesis New Beginnings Behavioral Health is a privately owned outpatient mental health group. We are dedicated to promoting the well-being of everyone. We are looking to make a difference within the community and provide accessible, quality mental health care for all. We emphasize compassion, respect, trust, and confidentiality. We are looking to create a comfortable and positive environment for patients, clinicians as well as staff! Our priority is patient care!
We are looking for full-time or part-time licensed clinicians, Licensed Clinical Professional Counselor (LCPC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) or Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) to work with children 5+ and youth for our Las Vegas office located in the Southwest Valley.
Therapist Job Responsibilities:
Establish positive, trusting rapport with patients.

Licensed Therapist to work with children and families. Flexible hours, group supervision and training offered. Blair Counseling and Mediation is a group practice that enjoys stable professional relationships as colleagues and are looking to expand our ability to support families. This role may be part-time or full-time.
Blair Counseling and Mediation works to provide tools to all ages that can be used to save marriages, relationships, manage depression or anxiety, and help children with behavioral concerns. We are certified to complete anger evaluations and anger management sessions for court. We provide a respectful and understanding approach to addiction. Our expert mediators aim to bring peace to marriages, families, divorces, and any other dispute. In addition to marriage and family mediation, we can provide divorce mediation, co-parenting counseling, reunification therapy and supervised visitations.
Christian, Spanish, American Sign Language and premarital services are also available. We also offer clinical supervision and underscore the importance of maintaining professional boundaries. Blair Counseling uses evidence-based practices like solution-focused, cognitive-behavioral, Gottman Couples Therapy, and Internal Family Systems Therapy to meet treatment goals.

Inside Passage Relationship Counseling is a boutique private group therapy practice in Bellingham, Washington dedicated to providing the highest quality, evidence-based relationship therapy to individuals, couples, and families.
We are hiring highly skilled, licensed therapists who want to work in a private practice environment with a group of passionate, inspiring, and supportive therapists. We can help you strike your ideal work-life balance with a part-time or full-time case load of highly motivated, appreciative clients.
We will take care of all the legal, business, and administrative obligations so that you can focus on doing your best, most fulfilling work. Therapists who work with us can earn between $64,000 and $104,000+ annually.
By joining our practice, you can focus on what you love: providing rewarding, effective therapy and we will take care of the rest, including:

We are professionals making a difference in our patients lives. Working at Ensemble you will be given the tools to be successful in your dream job, have peer and management support. Monthly all hands meeting includes individual spotlight awards, recognition, and other celebrations.

Our mission is to provide comprehensive, caring, and convenient board-certified Speech Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Physical Therapy, Applied Behavior Analysis Therapy, and Psychological services to children and adults of all ages and diagnoses. Utilizing a multidisciplinary approach, we provide effective personalized multi-lingual intervention that improves the lives of the individuals and families we serve.

About us
Autism F.I.R.S.T. Our mission is to deliver on our belief in Relational Autism Care, a simple and profound belief that as autism so greatly impacts the family dynamic that the treatment care must support and be available for all members of the family that are touched and impacted by autism – the patient, the family and all caregivers.
Autism F.I.R.S.T. is Northern Virginia’s only autism therapy practice to provide the ultimate collaborative treatment, advocacy, support, and care for the autistic child, family, and caregivers. We are seeking a Licensed Family Counselor (LPC; LCSW; LMFT) to contract with our team. Recognizing the profound impact autism has on the family and support system, we seek to provide broad collaborative care. The counselor will focus on providing family counseling services and support to the families and caregivers of autistic children following our relational autism care model.

Job Title: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist/Licensed Mental Health Counselor
Job Description:

We are hiring for part-time (15 clinical appointments a week) and full time positions (+20 clinical appointments a week); both employee and contractor positions.
We have senior level clinicians who provide support and supervision on a weekly basis. We have monthly trainings, yoga and meditation classes for staff. We enjoy our job and have a lot of fun.
Our client population is extremely varied as we have many talented clinicians with a variety of specialties. If you are looking to broaden your experience in working with children, teens, adults, or specific presenting problems this is a good place for you to work.

Stallant Health Crescent City is a rapidly-growing Rural Health Clinic located on the pristine coastline of northern California. Surrounding our location you will find endless camping, hiking, cycling, water sports, and many other outdoor activities. The nature here is stunning.

One of our biggest values is providing an outstanding, positive, and supportive work environment, allowing you to grow, explore, and develop your professional skills and interests as part of an incredible team. To do this, we need supportive teammates, so we hire the best we can, bringing together strong talent and personality into our workplace culture. This company is also growing rapidly and learning new things so we need people who can grow and flex just as much as we do.

Job Title: NY State licensed LCSW, LMHC, LMFT, Psychologist or Psychiatric NP
Job Description:
NY State licensed Psychotherapist or Psychologist
We are a private practice that has been in Kingston for more than 30 years. We are seeking NY State licensed psychotherapists - social workers (LCSW- best with R), Marriage and Family therapist, or psychologists - on a fee-for-service (hourly employment) basis. Looking for someone who has experience working with children, adolescents and adults.
I am a licensed psychologist, certified playtherapist-supervisor, certified group therapist, energy psychologist, sandtray therapist and modern psychoanalyst. I have been in practice in Kingston for more than 30 years. Presently, there are three psychologists, six clinical social workers, six licensed mental health counselors, one marriage and family therapist, one music therapist working several limited permit holders with me on a fee-for-service basis.
The office provides clients, office staff, office space, an electronic health record program, credentialing, and billing. At the moment all services are conducted via telehealth. We offer health insurance, vision and dental insurance, a retirement plan, and a match to the retirement plan, paid vacation and a bonus for extended hours worked on a quarterly basis. We are a very colleague-based team, and try to help each other out as much as possible. We usually have one social get together during the summer and one during the winter. We provide two weekly group consultations and individual consultation on an as needed basis. The practice is mainly managed care based, thus it would be very helpful if you were eligible or already on the managed care panels.

Blair Counseling and Mediation is a group practice that enjoys stable professional relationships as colleagues and are looking to expand our ability to support families. This role may be part-time or full-time.
Blair Counseling and Mediation works to provide tools to all ages that can be used to save marriages, relationships, manage depression or anxiety, and help children with behavioral concerns. We are certified to complete anger evaluations and anger management sessions for court. We provide a respectful and understanding approach to addiction. Our expert mediators aim to bring peace to marriages, families, divorces, and any other dispute. In addition to marriage and family mediation, we can provide divorce mediation, co-parenting counseling, reunification therapy and supervised visitations.
Christian, Spanish, American Sign Language and premarital services are also available. We also offer clinical supervision and underscore the importance of maintaining professional boundaries. Blair Counseling uses evidence-based practices like solution-focused, cognitive-behavioral, Gottman Couples Therapy, and Internal Family Systems Therapy to meet treatment goals.

Job Title: Licensed Mental Health Counselors for Flexible Contract Work
Job Description:
FLEXIBLE, PART-TIME, CONTRACT WORK AVAILABLE!!
We are offering a wonderful opportunity to support an existing income or retirement on a flexible schedule while providing a valuable service to the citizens of Maine. Very seldom is part time work offered which allows you to SET YOUR OWN SCHEDULE!!
Maximus is a leader in providing specialized assessment services and is partnered with the State of Maine to administer PASRR (Preadmission Screening and Resident Review) assessments.
PASRR is a federal requirement designed to ensure that individuals are not inappropriately placed into nursing homes for long term care services. All individuals seeking admittance to a Medicaid-certified nursing facility must be evaluated for serious mental illness (SMI) must be offered the most appropriate setting for their needs (in the community, a nursing facility, or acute care settings), and receive the services they need in those settings.

To apply for this position, please send both a cover letter and resume/CV to info at concentricchicago dot com. Applicants who do not provide a tailored Cover Letter will not be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. We strongly encourage you to visit our website to learn more about us by going to www dot concentricchicago dot com and Join Our Group page.
We are seeking a full-time* highly qualified therapist to join our group who values clinical excellence when providing therapy and other services to our clients. We are looking for a clinician who is passionate about the work you do and the people you serve. The ideal candidate is one who values responsive and detailed communication, integrity and authenticity, and who can work both independently and collaboratively with everyone in the group.
This therapist will be either fully licensed in Illinois (e.g LCPC, LMFT, LCSW) or provisionally (e.g AMFT, LPC, AMFT) and will have experience and training within Concentric's Clinical Areas, including relationship dynamics; couples and marriage therapy, complex, relational trauma; mood and anxiety disorders; mind-body connection; and life transitions. Substance misuse, abuse and/or compulsive behaviors experience and training are appreciated.

About us
Autism F.I.R.S.T. Our mission is to deliver on our belief in Relational Autism Care, a simple and profound belief that as autism so greatly impacts the family dynamic that the treatment care must support and be available for all members of the family that are touched and impacted by autism – the patient, the family and all caregivers.
Autism F.I.R.S.T. is Northern Virginia’s only autism therapy practice to provide the ultimate collaborative treatment, advocacy, support, and care for the autistic child, family, and caregivers. We are seeking a Licensed Family Counselor (LPC; LCSW; LMFT) to contract with our team. Recognizing the profound impact autism has on the family and support system, we seek to provide broad collaborative care. The counselor will focus on providing family counseling services and support to the families and caregivers of autistic children following our relational autism care model.

Job Title: Licensed Counselors, Social Workers, Marriage and Family Therapist
Job Description:
Agape Counseling Associates is experiencing rapid growth and we are seeking Licensed Therapists (Psychologists, Licensed Clinical Social Workers, Licensed Marriage and Family Therapists, Licensed Clinical Mental Health Counselor) to join our extremely busy practice in Morehead City.
Our relational team is committed to a mission of restoring souls to health and peace. Through Agape, enjoy the benefits of collaborating with your colleagues, gaining professional development and building your private practice with team members, who share your core values as a therapist.
We are passionate about helping individuals and families work through struggles with depression, anxiety, addictions, eating disorders, grief, trauma, PTSD, and co-occurring disorders.
For over 19 years, Agape Counseling has earned a stellar reputation, our clinicians are well respected in the community and known for specialized skills offering treatment for children to geriatrics and each life stage in between.

The Behavioral Health Center for Counseling & Learning, LLC is a thriving private practice that is a leader in providing exceptional services in Connecticut since 2006. The Center provides comprehensive services (individual, couples, families, and group therapy) throughout the entire developmental lifespan, from toddler to adolescent, and adult through geriatric. Our diverse clinical team has expertise in helping our clients address all of the issues that act as barriers to positive development and the achievement of success.
Our integrative approaches to wellness are unparalleled.
We are offering an exciting opportunity to practice as an independent contractor, while having the benefit of working with a skilled team of licensed and experienced professionals, some of whom have been practicing for decades.
Successful candidates must be licensed in CT.
Company Name: The Behavioral Health Center for Counseling & Learning, LLC

The Josselyn Center team is growing as we expand our Community Mental Health Centers in Northfield, IL and Waukegan, IL! We are seeking Master's Level Therapists to join our team!

The Josselyn Difference:
Josselyn is a not-for-profit mental health care provider treating clients from more than 90 communities across northern Cook and Lake counties, with a sliding fee scale.

Helping people while living satisfying, balanced lives. That is the focus for our team at Elevation Individual and Family Therapy. We are a team of licensed therapists that value providing quality, person-centered services in a low-stress environment to aid in a healthy work-life balance. You set your work hours, complete your progress notes and we take care of the rest! Job Description:
Licensed Therapist to work with children and families. Flexible hours, group supervision and training offered. Blair Counseling and Mediation is a group practice that enjoys stable professional relationships as colleagues and are looking to expand our ability to support families. This role may be part-time or full-time.
Blair Counseling and Mediation works to provide tools to all ages that can be used to save marriages, relationships, manage depression or anxiety, and help children with behavioral concerns. We are certified to complete anger evaluations and anger management sessions for court. We provide a respectful and understanding approach to addiction. Our expert mediators aim to bring peace to marriages, families, divorces, and any other dispute. In addition to marriage and family mediation, we can provide divorce mediation, co-parenting counseling, reunification therapy and supervised visitations.
Christian, Spanish, American Sign Language and premarital services are also available. We also offer clinical supervision and underscore the importance of maintaining professional boundaries. Blair Counseling uses evidence-based practices like solution-focused, cognitive-behavioral, Gottman Couples Therapy, and Internal Family Systems Therapy to meet treatment goals.

Licensed Therapist in California
Anchor Counseling Group, Inc. (ACG) is a community oriented group practice in Glendale, California. Our goal is to provide mental health services backed by experience, science, and proven treatments. We strive to make a difference in our community by promoting the growth and development of each of our client’s individual needs.
Our focus is also on providing a supportive environment for our clinicians. Our staff is always there to support the needs of the team and foster a culture of professionalism, collaboration and encouragement.
We are looking for a community minded, compassionate, and clinically skilled Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), and Clinical Psychologist. We have openings for full-time and part-time positions.

Are you a licensed marriage and family therapist looking to grow or launch a private practice? Headway has partnered with over 8,500 providers across the United States to help them run and build their practices, while making care more accessible and affordable for their clients.
Whether you're new to private practice or have an established practice of your own, we're excited to welcome you to the Headway community and help you reach your goals!
We’ll help you with...
Referrals: Use our referral streams to get matched with clients based on your preferences.
Insurance credentialing: Free, fast, and hassle-free credentialing with the nation’s largest networks.

Job Title: LMFT - Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist
Job Description:
Invo-Progressus is the nation’s leading special education and early intervention company nationwide, and we’re hiring! We are currently expanding our team of Licensed Marriage and Family Therapists in Fairfield, CA and have an incredible full-time opportunity available in an educational setting. For additional information, call 800-892-0640 to speak with a dedicated Career Services Manager.

For more than twenty years, Invo-Progressus has been providing therapeutic services that create better outcomes for children. The Invo-Progressus team is comprised of some of the nation’s most talented and influential education and therapy leaders all of whom have a keen understanding of how to meet the unique needs of school districts, children and families and help them succeed. We are committed to helping children and families, school leaders and clinicians achieve success.

Best Practices. Best Careers. Best Outcomes for Children.

Inside Passage Relationship Counseling is a boutique private group therapy practice in Bellingham, Washington dedicated to providing the highest quality, evidence-based relationship therapy to individuals, couples, and families.
We are hiring highly skilled, licensed therapists who want to work in a private practice environment with a group of passionate, inspiring, and supportive therapists. We can help you strike your ideal work-life balance with a part-time or full-time case load of highly motivated, appreciative clients.
We will take care of all the legal, business, and administrative obligations so that you can focus on doing your best, most fulfilling work. Therapists who work with us can earn between $64,000 and $104,000+ annually.
By joining our practice, you can focus on what you love: providing rewarding, effective therapy and we will take care of the rest, including:

To apply for this position, please send both a cover letter and resume/CV to info at concentricchicago dot com. Applicants who do not provide a tailored Cover Letter will not be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. We strongly encourage you to visit our website to learn more about us by going to www dot concentricchicago dot com and Join Our Group page.
We are seeking a full-time* highly qualified therapist to join our group who values clinical excellence when providing therapy and other services to our clients. We are looking for a clinician who is passionate about the work you do and the people you serve. The ideal candidate is one who values responsive and detailed communication, integrity and authenticity, and who can work both independently and collaboratively with everyone in the group.
This therapist will be either fully licensed in Illinois (e.g LCPC, LMFT, LCSW) or provisionally (e.g AMFT, LPC, AMFT) and will have experience and training within Concentric's Clinical Areas, including relationship dynamics; couples and marriage therapy, complex, relational trauma; mood and anxiety disorders; mind-body connection; and life transitions. Substance misuse, abuse and/or compulsive behaviors experience and training are appreciated.

Our clinic is seeking a Family Therapist with expertise in couples' therapy to primarily work with families. The ideal candidate will have earned their PhD in Family Therapy, have completed an APA accredited internship or post-doctoral residency, and have experience working with children, adolescents, adults and families. This is a full-time position that also requires the therapist to complete paperwork, client evaluations, client contact via email and phone, maintaining client confidentiality and assisting with corporate activities for the clinic.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Pay: $50.00 - $70.00 per hour
Benefits:
Dental insurance

About us
Autism F.I.R.S.T. Our mission is to deliver on our belief in Relational Autism Care, a simple and profound belief that as autism so greatly impacts the family dynamic that the treatment care must support and be available for all members of the family that are touched and impacted by autism – the patient, the family and all caregivers.
Autism F.I.R.S.T. is Northern Virginia’s only autism therapy practice to provide the ultimate collaborative treatment, advocacy, support, and care for the autistic child, family, and caregivers. We are seeking a Licensed Family Counselor (LPC; LCSW; LMFT) to contract with our team. Recognizing the profound impact autism has on the family and support system, we seek to provide broad collaborative care. The counselor will focus on providing family counseling services and support to the families and caregivers of autistic children following our relational autism care model.

Job Title: NY State licensed LCSW, LMHC, LMFT, Psychologist or Psychiatric NP
Job Description:
NY State licensed Psychotherapist or Psychologist
We are a private practice that has been in Kingston for more than 30 years. We are seeking NY State licensed psychotherapists - social workers (LCSW- best with R), Marriage and Family therapist, or psychologists - on a fee-for-service (hourly employment) basis. Looking for someone who has experience working with children, adolescents and adults.
I am a licensed psychologist, certified playtherapist-supervisor, certified group therapist, energy psychologist, sandtray therapist and modern psychoanalyst. I have been in practice in Kingston for more than 30 years. Presently, there are three psychologists, six clinical social workers, six licensed mental health counselors, one marriage and family therapist, one music therapist working several limited permit holders with me on a fee-for-service basis.
The office provides clients, office staff, office space, an electronic health record program, credentialing, and billing. At the moment all services are conducted via telehealth. We offer health insurance, vision and dental insurance, a retirement plan, and a match to the retirement plan, paid vacation and a bonus for extended hours worked on a quarterly basis. We are a very colleague-based team, and try to help each other out as much as possible. We usually have one social get together during the summer and one during the winter. We provide two weekly group consultations and individual consultation on an as needed basis. The practice is mainly managed care based, thus it would be very helpful if you were eligible or already on the managed care panels.

Bethany is changing the world through family. We began our work by serving one child more than 75 years ago. Today, Bethany is an international Christian nonprofit partnering with communities in more than 30 states and in several countries around the world. Job Title: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist/Licensed Mental Health Counselor
Job Description:
The Family Center is looking for clinicians to join our team of Marriage and Family Therapists and Mental Health Counselors. We provide individual, couples, and family therapy to people in the Baldwinsville and Syracuse community. We strive to provide an accepting caring atmosphere and solid therapeutic experience to our clients, while maintaining a healthy work life balance.
We are hiring for part-time (15 clinical appointments a week) and full time positions (+20 clinical appointments a week); both employee and contractor positions.
We have senior level clinicians who provide support and supervision on a weekly basis. We have monthly trainings, yoga and meditation classes for staff. We enjoy our job and have a lot of fun.
Our client population is extremely varied as we have many talented clinicians with a variety of specialties. If you are looking to broaden your experience in working with children, teens, adults, or specific presenting problems this is a good place for you to work.

Seattle Christian Counseling has an opening for a licensed mental health counselor in our Spokane Valley office.
We are an association of professional, independently licensed counselors who offer faith-based mental health counseling services throughout the Pacific Northwest.
Counselors provide outpatient mental health services to a predominantly faith- based clientele.
If you’re ready to grow or establish your private counseling practice in a supportive, encouraging work environment, we invite you to contact us today.

The Location
Stallant Health Crescent City is a rapidly-growing Rural Health Clinic located on the pristine coastline of northern California. Surrounding our location you will find endless camping, hiking, cycling, water sports, and many other outdoor activities. The nature here is stunning.
The Company
One of our biggest values is providing an outstanding, positive, and supportive work environment, allowing you to grow, explore, and develop your professional skills and interests as part of an incredible team. To do this, we need supportive teammates, so we hire the best we can, bringing together strong talent and personality into our workplace culture. This company is also growing rapidly and learning new things so we need people who can grow and flex just as much as we do.

Bilingual Psychotherapist
Victory Family Counseling is a modern client-centered, diverse, inclusive, multicultural therapy practice based in Concord, NC. We are seeking for a bilingual therapist (conditional or fully licensed LCSW, LFMA, MHC to provide psychotherapy for a diverse range of individuals, couples, and groups. This fee-for-service position in a private-practice setting presents a meaningful opportunity for clinicians to center clients from underserved backgrounds and earn hours towards their licensure.
Our practice is owned and operated by a woman person of color seeking to mentor and help others in the field. The practice operates based on an anti-oppressive model. Weekly supervision will be provided along with an opportunity to work alongside a social justice-minded staff.
This is a hybrid, flexible position. The ideal candidate will be able to conduct remote and in-person hours. Applicants must have the capacity to conduct teletherapy in a secure and private location and be able to come to the office in Concord, NC for some of their sessions.

Our mission is to deliver on our belief in Relational Autism Care, a simple and profound belief that as autism so greatly impacts the family dynamic that the treatment care must support and be available for all members of the family that are touched and impacted by autism – the patient, the family and all caregivers.
Autism F.I.R.S.T. is Northern Virginia’s only autism therapy practice to provide the ultimate collaborative treatment, advocacy, support, and care for the autistic child, family, and caregivers. We are seeking a Licensed Family Counselor (LPC; LCSW; LMFT) to contract with our team. Recognizing the profound impact autism has on the family and support system, we seek to provide broad collaborative care. The counselor will focus on providing family counseling services and support to the families and caregivers of autistic children following our relational autism care model.

Caring Therapists of Palm Beach, a group private practice in Wellington, Florida, is looking for part-time and/or full-time psychotherapists to join our thriving group practice. We are a collaborative group of therapists that work well together in the office.
Our office is centrally located in Wellington, near Royal Palm Beach, West Palm Beach, Lake Worth, and Loxahatchee. Requirements include being fully licensed in the State of Florida with 1-year post-independent licensure experience, preferably with private practice experience and registered with CAQH and willingness to be paneled with insurance companies.

The candidate must be independent, driven, collaborative, and enhance our fun, connected, and a positive-minded group of clinicians. Our office is well-respected in the community, and we are looking for therapists who are passionate about mental health. The candidate will be independent contractor status.

Foundations Counseling, LLC is expanding once again.
We cater to a clientele who expects an exceptional level of service. Therefore, we are looking for someone who has an extreme reverence for the profession - a reverence for the honor to serve people, a reverence for the profound impact we make in the lives of others, a reverence for who we are and what we do.
The candidate we are looking for is also driven - driven to provide a superior level of service to clients, driven to be an exceptional therapist, driven to be an exceptional individual, driven to be an exceptional teammate. The drive for personal growth and development is innate. The drive to be the best is not something you do, it is who you are.
The ideal candidate will have outstanding people skills and therapeutic skills and preferably be a Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC), a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT), a Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), a Licensed Psychologist, a National Certified Counselor (NCC), or a combination thereof. We will also consider Registered / Unlicensed Psychotherapists and Counselor Candidates who meet the criteria listed below.

Job Title: NY State licensed LCSW, LMHC, LMFT, Psychologist or Psychiatric NP
Job Description:
NY State licensed Psychotherapist or Psychologist
We are a private practice that has been in Kingston for more than 30 years. We are seeking NY State licensed psychotherapists - social workers (LCSW- best with R), Marriage and Family therapist, or psychologists - on a fee-for-service (hourly employment) basis. Looking for someone who has experience working with children, adolescents and adults.
I am a licensed psychologist, certified playtherapist-supervisor, certified group therapist, energy psychologist, sandtray therapist and modern psychoanalyst. I have been in practice in Kingston for more than 30 years. Presently, there are three psychologists, six clinical social workers, six licensed mental health counselors, one marriage and family therapist, one music therapist working several limited permit holders with me on a fee-for-service basis.
The office provides clients, office staff, office space, an electronic health record program, credentialing, and billing. At the moment all services are conducted via telehealth. We offer health insurance, vision and dental insurance, a retirement plan, and a match to the retirement plan, paid vacation and a bonus for extended hours worked on a quarterly basis. We are a very colleague-based team, and try to help each other out as much as possible. We usually have one social get together during the summer and one during the winter. We provide two weekly group consultations and individual consultation on an as needed basis. The practice is mainly managed care based, thus it would be very helpful if you were eligible or already on the managed care panels.

Behavioral Counselor/Family Therapist Job Summary
The Center for Children and Families is seeking family therapists in our Monroe, LA location, servicing the Northeast Louisiana region. The positions are available in a number of our therapy programs including Functional Family Therapy (FFT,) Functional Family Therapy - Child Welfare (FFT-CW,) and Multisystemic Therapy (MST.) Job Title: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist/Licensed Mental Health Counselor
Job Description:
The Family Center is looking for clinicians to join our team of Marriage and Family Therapists and Mental Health Counselors. We provide individual, couples, and family therapy to people in the Baldwinsville and Syracuse community. We strive to provide an accepting caring atmosphere and solid therapeutic experience to our clients, while maintaining a healthy work life balance.
We are hiring for part-time (15 clinical appointments a week) and full time positions (+20 clinical appointments a week); both employee and contractor positions.
We have senior level clinicians who provide support and supervision on a weekly basis. We have monthly trainings, yoga and meditation classes for staff. We enjoy our job and have a lot of fun.
Our client population is extremely varied as we have many talented clinicians with a variety of specialties. If you are looking to broaden your experience in working with children, teens, adults, or specific presenting problems this is a good place for you to work.

What we're looking for:
NAMHS is looking for a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist to join our team in Salinas, CA. NAMHS is looking for patient focused therapist for a variety of patients. If you have the necessary skills and experience to succeed in this role, we want to hear from you.
What we offer:
We offer an unmatched extensive training program for our providers to be successful. We offer paid supervision hours with a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist. Benefits package offers paid vacation, sick time, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and 401K.
Working with us:

The Location
Stallant Health Crescent City is a rapidly-growing Rural Health Clinic located on the pristine coastline of northern California. Surrounding our location you will find endless camping, hiking, cycling, water sports, and many other outdoor activities. The nature here is stunning.
The Company
One of our biggest values is providing an outstanding, positive, and supportive work environment, allowing you to grow, explore, and develop your professional skills and interests as part of an incredible team. To do this, we need supportive teammates, so we hire the best we can, bringing together strong talent and personality into our workplace culture. This company is also growing rapidly and learning new things so we need people who can grow and flex just as much as we do.

Bilingual Psychotherapist
Victory Family Counseling is a modern client-centered, diverse, inclusive, multicultural therapy practice based in Concord, NC. We are seeking for a bilingual therapist (conditional or fully licensed LCSW, LFMA, MHC to provide psychotherapy for a diverse range of individuals, couples, and groups. This fee-for-service position in a private-practice setting presents a meaningful opportunity for clinicians to center clients from underserved backgrounds and earn hours towards their licensure.
Our practice is owned and operated by a woman person of color seeking to mentor and help others in the field. The practice operates based on an anti-oppressive model. Weekly supervision will be provided along with an opportunity to work alongside a social justice-minded staff.
This is a hybrid, flexible position. The ideal candidate will be able to conduct remote and in-person hours. Applicants must have the capacity to conduct teletherapy in a secure and private location and be able to come to the office in Concord, NC for some of their sessions.

Job Title: Licensed Counselors, Social Workers, Marriage and Family Therapist
Job Description:
Agape Counseling Associates is experiencing rapid growth and we are seeking Licensed Therapists (Psychologists, Licensed Clinical Social Workers, Licensed Marriage and Family Therapists, Licensed Clinical Mental Health Counselor) to join our extremely busy practice in Morehead City.
Our relational team is committed to a mission of restoring souls to health and peace. Through Agape, enjoy the benefits of collaborating with your colleagues, gaining professional development and building your private practice with team members, who share your core values as a therapist.
We are passionate about helping individuals and families work through struggles with depression, anxiety, addictions, eating disorders, grief, trauma, PTSD, and co-occurring disorders.
For over 19 years, Agape Counseling has earned a stellar reputation, our clinicians are well respected in the community and known for specialized skills offering treatment for children to geriatrics and each life stage in between.

Helping people while living satisfying, balanced lives. That is the focus for our team at Elevation Individual and Family Therapy. We are a team of licensed therapists that value providing quality, person-centered services in a low-stress environment to aid in a healthy work-life balance. You set your work hours, complete your progress notes and we take care of the rest! Elevation IFT is looking for a passionate, reliable therapist who enjoys being their own boss and working with clients to achieve their treatment goals.
To learn more about us, visit our website at www.elevationtherapy.org
Responsibilities
Collaborate with clients to develop treatment plans
Maintain clinical progress notes and other required documentation that meets the standards of insurance companies and Employee Assistance Programs (EAP).
Company Name: Elevation Individual and Family Therapy, LLC

Job Description:
The Behavioral Health Center for Counseling & Learning, LLC is a thriving private practice that is a leader in providing exceptional services in Connecticut since 2006. The Center provides comprehensive services (individual, couples, families, and group therapy) throughout the entire developmental lifespan, from toddler to adolescent, and adult through geriatric. Our diverse clinical team has expertise in helping our clients address all of the issues that act as barriers to positive development and the achievement of success.
Our integrative approaches to wellness are unparalleled.
We are offering an exciting opportunity to practice as an independent contractor, while having the benefit of working with a skilled team of licensed and experienced professionals, some of whom have been practicing for decades.
Successful candidates must be licensed in CT.
Company Name: The Behavioral Health Center for Counseling & Learning, LLC

Job Description:
Licensed Therapist in California
Anchor Counseling Group, Inc. (ACG) is a community oriented group practice in Glendale, California. Our goal is to provide mental health services backed by experience, science, and proven treatments. We strive to make a difference in our community by promoting the growth and development of each of our client’s individual needs.
Our focus is also on providing a supportive environment for our clinicians. Our staff is always there to support the needs of the team and foster a culture of professionalism, collaboration and encouragement.
We are looking for a community minded, compassionate, and clinically skilled Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), and Clinical Psychologist. We have openings for full-time and part-time positions.

To apply for this position, please send both a cover letter and resume/CV to info at concentricchicago dot com. Applicants who do not provide a tailored Cover Letter will not be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. We strongly encourage you to visit our website to learn more about us by going to www dot concentricchicago dot com and Join Our Group page.
We are seeking a full-time* highly qualified therapist to join our group who values clinical excellence when providing therapy and other services to our clients. We are looking for a clinician who is passionate about the work you do and the people you serve. The ideal candidate is one who values responsive and detailed communication, integrity and authenticity, and who can work both independently and collaboratively with everyone in the group.
This therapist will be either fully licensed in Illinois (e.g LCPC, LMFT, LCSW) or provisionally (e.g AMFT, LPC, AMFT) and will have experience and training within Concentric's Clinical Areas, including relationship dynamics; couples and marriage therapy, complex, relational trauma; mood and anxiety disorders; mind-body connection; and life transitions. Substance misuse, abuse and/or compulsive behaviors experience and training are appreciated.

Licensed Therapist to work with children and families. Flexible hours, group supervision and training offered. Blair Counseling and Mediation is a group practice that enjoys stable professional relationships as colleagues and are looking to expand our ability to support families. This role may be part-time or full-time.
Blair Counseling and Mediation works to provide tools to all ages that can be used to save marriages, relationships, manage depression or anxiety, and help children with behavioral concerns. We are certified to complete anger evaluations and anger management sessions for court. We provide a respectful and understanding approach to addiction. Our expert mediators aim to bring peace to marriages, families, divorces, and any other dispute. In addition to marriage and family mediation, we can provide divorce mediation, co-parenting counseling, reunification therapy and supervised visitations.
Christian, Spanish, American Sign Language and premarital services are also available. We also offer clinical supervision and underscore the importance of maintaining professional boundaries. Blair Counseling uses evidence-based practices like solution-focused, cognitive-behavioral, Gottman Couples Therapy, and Internal Family Systems Therapy to meet treatment goals.

Josselyn is a not-for-profit mental health care provider treating clients from more than 90 communities across northern Cook and Lake counties, with a sliding fee scale.

We are hiring highly skilled, licensed therapists who want to work in a private practice environment with a group of passionate, inspiring, and supportive therapists. We can help you strike your ideal work-life balance with a part-time or full-time case load of highly motivated, appreciative clients.

Our clinic is seeking a Family Therapist with expertise in couples' therapy to primarily work with families. The ideal candidate will have earned their PhD in Family Therapy, have completed an APA accredited internship or post-doctoral residency, and have experience working with children, adolescents, adults and families. This is a full-time position that also requires the therapist to complete paperwork, client evaluations, client contact via email and phone, maintaining client confidentiality and assisting with corporate activities for the clinic.

Welcome to Foresight Mental Health. We're so glad you're considering joining our team.
More support and innovative tools for better care
As a provider with Foresight, we want you to focus on what's most important - treating and caring for our members. Which is why we have a team dedicated to handling all the administrative aspects of therapy: credentialing, scheduling, billing and marketing.
